You are here:

Set Up a Multi-Instance Hierarchy

When you create a multi-instance product model, you work with coverage specs, insured item specs, and insured party specs a little bit differently.

To learn about multi-instance product structures, see Build Insurance Product Models.

Set Up Insured Items and Insured Parties as Children of Other Insured Items for Multi-Instance
You can create a parent-child relationship for insured items. This works a little bit differently than associating coverages with insured items.
Set Up Coverages as Children of Insured Items for Multi-Instance
After you add coverages to a root product spec, you can associate them with an insured item.

DID THIS ARTICLE SOLVE YOUR ISSUE?
Yes
No
title: Setting Up Insurance Product Models and Hierarchy
